title: Metro League teams "Purple Out" #4Nathalie
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Metro League teams "Purple Out" #4Nathalie Friday nights in the Metro League are not only a battle on the field between football teams, but off the field, as well, between student sections. Post to Facebook Metro League teams "Purple Out" #4Nathalie Friday nights in the Metro League are not only a battle on the field between football teams, but off the field, as well, between student sections.  //on.kgw.com/1LkSsjX   Metro League teams "Purple Out" #4Nathalie Nate Hanson, KGW.com Staff 5:05 p.m. PDT October 8, 2015 Metro League schools will "purple out" Friday night in honor of Nathalie Traller. (Photo: @SHSUpdates Twitter) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
PORTLAND, Ore. -- Friday nights in the Metro League are not only a battle on the field between football teams, but off the field, as well, between student sections. 
But this Friday night will be different. 
Sunset student Nathalie Traller, 16, died on Monday night after a battle with Alveolar Soft Part Sarcoma (ASPS) , a rare and incurable form of cancer. 
What started as a social media push for Sunset students to wear purple, or "purple out," at the Apollos game Friday night at Beaverton, has launched into a calling for the community to come together to honor Nathalie. 
The hashtag #4Nathalie and #WeAreMetro has spread on social media and not only will Sunset students be donning purple on Friday night, so will every other student section in the Metro League. 
Twitter accounts associated with all eight schools in the Metro League have asked students to wear purple Friday night in Nathalie's memory. 
To learn about Nathalie and her battle with ASPS, click here . <!--iframe-->
